title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Rep. Mary Cavanagh Arrest

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Rep. Mary Cavanagh Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: February 25, 2023
Location: Livonia, Michigan
Individual Involved: Mary Cavanagh, 30
Incident Summary: Rep. Mary Cavanagh was pulled over around 2 a.m. after officers observed her swerving between lanes and driving with two flat tires. During the traffic stop, she admitted to drinking at a political fundraiser and underwent a field sobriety test, which she failed. Officers conducted a breathalyzer test, recording a BAC of .176% on scene and later .2% at the police station. She was subsequently arrested for driving under the influence.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Conducted the traffic stop and initial interaction with Rep. Cavanagh.
Administered the field sobriety test and breathalyzer.
Transported her to the Livonia Police Department for further testing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Scott Russell Granden Arrest

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Scott Russell Granden Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: March 25, 2021
Location: Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, Atlanta, GA
Individual Involved: Scott Russell Granden, 36
Incident Summary: Granden was arrested upon landing after allegedly sexually assaulting a female passenger aboard a Southwest Airlines flight. The victim reported that Granden groped her while she was asleep and later smacked her buttocks when she stood up. Upon arrival at the airport, Atlanta Police officers detained Granden, who was reportedly intoxicated and made racist and homophobic slurs toward officers. He also pulled down his pants and shouted inappropriate remarks.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the aircraft upon landing and interacted with Scott Russell Granden.
Documented Granden’s statements and behavior during his detention and arrest.
Transported Granden following the arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – David Koechner DUI Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: June 4, 2022
Individual Involved: David Koechner (actor, known for Anchorman and The Office)
Incident Summary: Ohio State Troopers pulled over David Koechner after observing alleged "lane violations" while he was driving. Upon contact, officers noted the smell of alcohol and observed glossy eyes. Koechner admitted to consuming "one beer" and refused a breathalyzer test. Officers conducted a field sobriety test before placing him under arrest for Operating a Vehicle Impaired (OVI).
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Initiated the traffic stop and interacted with David Koechner.
Conducted the field sobriety test and any additional questioning.
Participated in the arrest and transport of Koechner.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Charles Snowden DUI Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: December 9, 2024
Location: Rainbow Boulevard near Sunset Road, Las Vegas, Nevada
Individual Involved: Charles Snowden (Las Vegas Raiders player)
Incident Summary: Officers responded to a report of a suspicious vehicle at approximately 11:30 p.m. and found Charles Snowden passed out behind the wheel of a running 2017 Jeep Grand Cherokee. The vehicle was in neutral and nearly rolled off a four-foot retaining wall. Upon interacting with officers, Snowden appeared disoriented, initially stating that he believed he was in Florida. A breathalyzer test later showed a blood alcohol level more than double the legal limit.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Initially arrived at the scene and located Charles Snowden in his vehicle.
Interacted with Snowden and conducted any field sobriety or breathalyzer tests.
Participated in the arrest and transport of Snowden.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sandra Doorley Traffic Stop

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sandra Doorley Traffic Stop
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 04/22/2024
Location: Webster, New York (Phillips Road and Doorley’s residence)
Individual Involved: Sandra Doorley (Monroe County District Attorney)
Incident Summary: On the date of the incident, DA Sandra Doorley was reportedly stopped for speeding—driving 55 mph in a 35 mph zone. Instead of pulling over, she called Webster Police Chief Dennis Kohlmeier and proceeded home, refusing to comply with the officer’s order to stop. Bodycam footage shows a tense exchange in which she stated she "didn’t feel like stopping" and refused to exit her garage. The officer informed her that failure to stop is an arrestable offense.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Attempted to pull over Sandra Doorley for the traffic violation.
Responded to her residence and engaged in conversation with her.
Communicated with Police Chief Dennis Kohlmeier regarding the situation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Harun

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – DaniLeigh DUI Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: May 30, 2023
Location: Miami Beach, Florida
Individual Involved: Danielle Leigh Curiel (DaniLeigh)
Incident Summary: Miami Beach police arrested DaniLeigh around 8:15 AM following a DUI hit-and-run crash that left a moped driver with serious injuries, including a kidney laceration and spinal fracture. Officers reported that DaniLeigh was speeding and swerving before striking the victim. She was later stopped and administered a breathalyzer, which showed a BAC of 0.148—nearly twice the legal limit. The arrest resulted in three felony charges, including DUI with serious bodily injury and leaving the scene of an accident.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the crash scene and interacted with the injured victim.
Conducted the traffic stop on DaniLeigh’s vehicle.
Administered the field sobriety and breathalyzer tests.
Processed her arrest and transport to Turner Guilford Knight Correctional Center.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.communication:

Location: Palm Beach County, FL

Conducted the traffic stop and initial field sobriety test.
Interacted with Christina Laboy during her verbal outbursts.

Booked her into custody and documented her continued behavior.

title: Crime Incident Data Request (Tulsa Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2009, 2011, and 2013
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Arrest of Monika Hladik

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Arrest of Monika Hladik
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Location: Clearwater, FL
Suspect: Monika Hladik, 41
Incident Summary: Hladik, a former managerial accountant for Inspecs USA, was arrested for allegedly embezzling $710,531 from the company between 2016 and 2022. Authorities state that she wrote 232 unauthorized checks to herself, forged her employer’s signature, and manipulated QuickBooks accounting entries to conceal the theft. The investigation began after a complaint was filed by the company president. Hladik was arrested and charged with a scheme to defraud.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the complaint and conducted any preliminary investigations.
Located and arrested Monika Hladik.
Transported her to the Pinellas County Jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: June 27, 2019, July 1, 2019(Arrest)
Location: Clear Sky Cafe, Clearwater, FL
Suspect: Serina Wolfe
Incident Summary: Serina Wolfe allegedly used her boyfriend’s credit card without permission to leave a $5,055.37 tip at Clear Sky Cafe after an argument. The dispute began when Wolfe’s boyfriend refused to buy her a flight home to New York. He placed a hold on his credit card, but once it was removed, Wolfe made the unauthorized transaction. The restaurant was later informed of the fraudulent charge, but the waitress had already received the tip. Wolfe was arrested on July 1st on theft charges and booked on a $2,000 bond.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to Clear Sky Cafe to investigate the incident.
Spoke with the restaurant staff and the victim regarding the unauthorized charge.
Located and arrested Serina Wolfe.
Transported Wolfe to the Pinellas County Jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: FBI support for 2020- TV  documentary series "Bloodline Detectives"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2020- TV  documentary series "Bloodline Detectives"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2020- TV documentary series "Bloodline Detectives," hosted by Nancy Grace. Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Bloodline Detectives," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "Bloodline Detectives."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: UAB FRS

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: UAB FRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal years 2004 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

If your department does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian’s name and address.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely.  Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

With the exception of exhibits that are under seal I am requesting release of all trial exhibits, in the case of the State of Indian vs Richard Allen.  Richard Allen was convicted and sentenced October 31st 2024 and the judge assured that after the gag order was lifted at sentencing trial exhibits would be made public as the transcript is being prepared. She has since then instructed her court reporter to advise the public that possibly someday these will be made available. Brett Carollo
